headline: Beef Stroganoff
description: The best beef stroganoff recipes use flavorsome beef, hearty mushrooms, mustard, white wine, and sour cream for tender and delicious results!

video.description: See how to make a 5-star beef stroganoff recipe.
video.name: Beef Stroganoff III

name: Beef Stroganoff
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Remove any fat and gristle from chuck roast; cut into strips 1/2-inch thick by 2-inches long. Season with ½ teaspoon salt and ½ teaspoon pepper.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add beef and brown quickly.
Push beef to one side of the skillet. Add onions; cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes, then push to the side with beef.

Stir flour into juices on the empty side of the pan. Pour in beef broth and bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Lower the heat and stir in mustard. Cover and simmer for 1 hour or until the beef is tender.
Five minutes before serving, stir in mushrooms, sour cream, and white wine. Cook until heated through; season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic
Followed the recipe. Meal had close to zero flavor. Will find another one next time.

We loved it, but I think that marinating the steak for a longer period of time, say 3 hours, would give a more tender steak. I agree that more than 1/4 tea of pepper flakes would be too much. I haven't done much real cooking since I got cancer, and this recipe gave me some new confidence. Thanks for sharing.
Used fresh mushrooms in place of canned. Served over egg noodles. OMG. What a fantastic meal.
Made per recipe, and it was delicious!

I have been searching for a particular taste in a beef stroganoff. This is it! The person (Beezlys) made some great modifications that I mostly followed. Here is my adjustments to that. I used already smoked brisket so it was cooked and tender and has a nice strong smokey beef flavor. This is a perfect recipe to use left over beef brisket!! 1/3 cup cream cheese is also a must. I would add that white wine is exactly the flavor (just a little bite) that really goes well in this. I don't think red wine would have the same twang. I had some shiitake and chanterelle mushrooms that needed to be used. And why not throw in some home grown leaks too! Very tasty.

I got inspired to make Beef Stroganoff because my mom wanted to have Hamburger Helper Beef Stroganoff. I wanted to make some of my own and found this recipe. It turned out to be very tasty! Both of my parents and I really enjoyed this. Absolute comfort food! Like a few others, I marinated the beef for 1.5 hours in white wine and Worcestershire sauce. Next time, I'll try red! It really made the meat flavorful and tender. I also marinated the mushrooms in Worcestershire sauce in a separate bag. I added a few teaspoons of minced garlic when cooking the onions and I added the mushrooms to the pot while it was simmering. I also added 1/3 cup cream cheese along with the sour cream. I'll definitely make again! This went great with cornbread too :)

Yes, I made this wonderful dish once again. Family just loves it!. I must say that I used more beef broth than recommended in the recipe because maybe I added too much flour. I also added less wine and less sour cream. Thank once again for sharing.

I’m sure I made some detours from the original recipe but I used this as a template since I’ve never made beef stroganoff. I’m a single dad in grad school and don’t have a lot of time for meal prep. This recipe was good because it had an hour of simmer time that allowed me to work on other things. I definitely added some garlic powder and a little bit of the greens from the onions. I used beef fajita meat because that was what was available. But it turned out amazing! Very solid recipe!

Used left over beef tenderloin when making this. I sauteed the onions a bit, then added the mushrooms and some minced garlic that I didn't measure, added the meat to heat it up. Doubled the sauce so I added 4 tbls of corn starch to one can of condensed soup and 4 tbsp of flour to the other, stirred that in then added the mustard and Worcestershire sauce. Cooked it a bit to thicken the sauce then added 1/3 cup cream cheese (doubled) and 1/3 sour cream doubled. Served it over brown rice, the boys loved it, so good!

This is an incredibly delicious and easy recipe! For the mustard I used Grey Poupon Dijon. I also used sliced fresh Portobello mushrooms and browned them a bit just after sautéing the onions; instead of adding them later as directed with canned mushrooms. My family loved this Stroganoff and I definitely will be making it more often.

I made this exactly as directed the first time, and my beef was tough. i followed suggestions in the comments the second time, but the beef is still tough. The flavor was better when I followed revisions (marinating), but it is still so chewy. The flavor is great, just not meal I'd recommend to anyone with a toddler.

This was great! I followed most, but had to tweak a little. I added some Worstershire sauce and beef broth to beef, and instead of condense beef broth I used cream of mushroom soup, i didn't have green onion so i used a yellow onion and 1/4 tea of paprika. I also did the rue separate. I was afraid tge flour would clump up as I didn't have much room in my pan. Lol. This was delicious!! However, I will add less butter next time. But definitely great recipe.
I find canned mushrooms gross. I used fresh mushrooms, and it tasted good. No green onions, subbed 1 cup finely chopped yellow with no problem.
It was delicious. I used fresh mushrooms and followed the basic recipe
Made this tonight. It was a BIG HIT with my family!!! Thank you for sharing it. I’ll make it again.

I used fresh mushrooms instead of canned and Campbell red wine beef both. Dijon mustard and red wine instead of yellow mustard and white wine. 
Marinated stewing beef in Worcestershire sauce garlic and red wine over night. Always Himalayan pink salt instead of any other kind of salt in all of my recipes.
Yesss, came out AMAZING
Next time I’ll add more red pepper and I added I tbl spoon of tomato paste. Was delicious.
Nice simple recipe (I don't eat much of it mainly because I am not a meat eater - make it for my wife mostly) I added 3 cloves of garlic to it in order to give it some punch.
Just made it. Left out the garlic but otherwise stayed true to the recipe. It was fantastic! Thanks so much!
Excellent 5 stars. Added tbsp. of Worcestershire sauce cause I like it. Simple, tasty & easy beef stroganoff. will do again.

With exception of making sautéed mushrooms ( following Allrecipes “Superb Sautéed Mushrooms which is a 5 star recipe) made this recipe exactly as written. Turned out good but not great. Next time will follow suggestions made by other reviewers. Looking for a more flavorful sauce.

I followed the recipe except I added a little garlic and worchestire sauce, and used fresh baby portobello mushrooms, because canned shrooms are gross. Served over egg noodles with roasted broccoli. 

My six year old loved it. The eight year old hated it and had to hold her nose to find it remotely palatable. My 12 year old didn’t complain about it, which is unusual, and my 17 year old didn’t eat it because she’s a vegetarian. I asked my husband if he hated it too, and he quickly replied “yep”. 

He told me that something was missing but he didn’t know what. 

I thought it was pretty good- especially after I added a little more salt and pepper. I’ll enjoy the leftovers tomorrow.
Added orange sweet pepper and peas. Things my mother and my wife added to their stroganoff over the years. Excellent recipe, thanks!
I made this but it seemed like the taste of Ketchup overwhelmed it. I will make it again but eliminate the ketchup.

People! The butter is used with the flour to make the roux! The roux thickens the beef broth. You can replace the butter with another fat but you can’t remove it because then the flour won’t have enough fat for the roux especially if you use a leaner cut of meat. Usually equal parts fat and flour. There are other methods to thicken a liquid so maybe research those if you don’t want to use butter.
Hearty and delicious
I prepared the Storganoff as written. My husband loved it and had two helpings. We enjoyed the leftover as well as the first serving. I will be making this recipe again.
Hands down the best beef stroganoff we have ever had. I like to add a little more mustard and more mushrooms.
I made this the other day and used the suggestions give with the creme cheese and sour cream along with soaking in red wine. I used a Pinot noir. It was very tasty and rich.
This is a fantastic recipe. I served it for company, and we all decided this recipe is a keeper-repeater. Like others, I marinated the beef in red wine for a couple of hours.

I used fresh Baby Bella mushrooms instead of canned. Also, I added some of the greens from the onions as a garnish and it worked great. Served over some wonderful egg noodles that I bought at the German Deli in Sanford Fl. So I didn't make the noodles homemade. Served with a side of mashed potatoes.
I skipped butter, used yellow instead of green onions, added 1 tablespoon minced garlic, used fresh mushrooms and added 1 tablespoon worchestershire sauce.
I have made this Stroganoff several times. My family loves it and it is super simple
Used the recipe for 2 and it was tasteless. Added more red wine and still no good.Sigh.
great recipe. I didn't have wine, still awesome

Soooo good! My oldest son, 19, said “How did you do this? It tastes amazing, best you’ve ever made!” He even asked me to make it again the next day. As far as I’m concerned, it is delicious and I will definitely be making it again.
I’ve made this several times and love it! Easy, tender, flavorful!!

I came across about 1/2 lb of beef chuck while going through my freezer. Looking for something to do with it, I found this highly rated recipe, which turned out very good, scaling it in half. I didn't cook this for the full hour stated, as the pieces were small. I tested them during the cooking time and also didn't want them to dry out. Probably cooked for around 35 min. The pieces do shrink, too. Delicious over some noodles. Very hearty and satisfying dish. Thanks for the recipe!

I loved the recipe so much I joined this site. We used eye tip roast which is extremely lean and can be tough and dry. However, this recipe included time to slow cook the thin strips of meat and it was soaked in white wine, pepper and salt for about half hour before cooking. It was so easy to make and we all loved it! Will be making this often.
I followed the instructions as written. It was excellent.

This recipe is very tasty. I followed other cooks reviews and marinated the meat first. I would of also added cream cheese but did not have that. I will absolutely make this again! Thank you for all the delicious recipes!!

The first time my stroganoff wasn’t a disaster! I did make a few mods but not because of the recipe - more because of my family’s needs. I, similar to others, marinated the meat in red wine - smelled sooo good while I was prepping the other items - I also used Italian herbs in the marinade. I used gluten free flour - was an easy swap. Rather than adding all of the flour to the pan, I used 2T to mix with the salt and pepper and tossed the meat in this mixture before I added the meat to the pan. The last thing I changed was using dairy free sour cream. Everything worked great and even my picky teen gobbled it up.
This was a great recipe. I added minced garlic and fresh mushrooms. Didn't have green onions so added minced onion and parsley to garnish. My 4 yr old loved it!
This recipe is superb!!!!

I followed the recipe to the letter. I thought chuck roast sounded strange for beef stroganoff - but I used it. Of course the meat was tough and not tender or tasty. I won't be using this recipe again...
Delicious
I changed it by using my own broth and put a lot of mushrooms

This was delicious. I add cream cheese instead of sour cream for a creamier sauce and a splash of Worcestershire sauce. You can use red wine if you don’t have white. My husband loves it - will definitely make it again!

Pretty bland when made as-is, I added a dash of thyme, clove of garlic, glug of worchestire sauce, and a few shakes of general purpose seasoning and those things took it over the edge to become my favorite stroganoff recipe!
This was super easy to make and came out PERFECTLY TASTY!!!!

Excellent. I turned this into a Gluten Free recipe by substituting equal measure King Arthur Measure for Measure, it came out very tasty with some of my own flavor modifications (below). However I will do the thickener different next time and not use the KA flour. It has Xanthum Gum in it which I rarely use in GF cooking because it has a tendency to get things a little slimy.

Thank you for sharing your recipe. The next time I will try it with organic ground beef or ground turkey, white wine added in at the end, 1 1/2 T. Worcestershire sauce, 1/2 c. sour cream, and 1 small package of Cremini mushrooms and maybe fresh parsley as a garnish. Thank you so much for the great recipe!
Amazing taste and super easy...will definitely make again!!!
Made this with light sour creme and served over noodles. It was outstanding! Great recipe!

I can’t not mess with a recipe. This is a great one but as usual I mess a bit. I use a mix of white mushrooms and baby Bella’s. Use both olive oil and butter. Diced onion and several cloves of garlic smashed and diced. To cheat Wehrmacht I don’t have time to roast a tri-tip or a pot roast, I used deli Aviles roast beef from the deli counter and just cut it up and mix it in just before serving so it warms up. Add some beef bullion in the sauce as needed to boost the beef flavor if the beef stock doesn’t give enough. And must sprinkle it all with paprika!

Tasty. I did a few things differently. I marinaded the beef in red wine for 1 hours and cooked the beef for 3 hours. Added 6 cloves of garlic. Sliced the onion rather than chopping, Added horseradish and worchester sauce. Used mini bella mushrooms which were added at the same time as the cream cheese, so they were not over cooked. Delish... Recipe only fed 4 people.
This recipe is really good. I followed the recipe and can’t think of anything I would change. This is top shelf comfort food.

I initially had another beef stroganoff recipe, but when I found this one I decided to combine the two. A few of the changes I made in doing so was using one yellow onion instead of green onions, adding a bay leaf during the hour long cooking period, and doubling the amount of mustard. I used whole grain mustard and I feel like this is a must, it added such a great flavor to the dish. I also substituted plain Greek yogurt for sour cream to cut out some of the fat and honestly couldn’t taste the difference. Very rich and tender!

I followed the recipe but took the advice and marinated the meat in white wine for two hours. The meat was very tender. I also removed the meat when preparing the sauce. Just makes it easier to maneuver. Great recipe!

My family loves this recipe with or without the mushrooms (because my children aren’t fans of mushrooms sometimes I just leave them out). Otherwise I make it exactly like suggested. It’s an excellent comfort food kind of recipe.

Delicious and easy to make! The positive: the instructions to brown your meat, then push aside and brown your onions, then push aside and add flour to make gravy all in the same pan worked! I really didn't think it would - I thought the gravy would get lumpy - it came out silky smooth. The cons: the recipe called for way too much butter. I prepared the amount asked for but it became clear after melted that it simply butter overkill. After reading the rest of the recipe, I just didn't see how it was necessary, so I used half. Lucky for me, that worked out just fine. Also, the chuck was still a tad tough, so maybe I needed a bit more simmering time. Another change: I didn't have white wine (recipe asks for 1/3 cup) so I used a 1/4 cup white wine vinegar. It all turned out great! I'm keeping this one in my favourites for sure!

We really liked this recipe. I didn't have any wine so omitted that ingredient but since we rarely have wine or cook with it we didn't miss it at all. I did take the advice of other reviewers and added 1/3 brick of cream cheese in addition to the 1/3 cup of sour cream near the end which made the flavor so rich and delicious! Oh and I also used cut up sirloin tip steak instead of chuck roast because that's what I had on hand and it was so tender. I browned my meat with my diced onions and seasoned with salt, pepper and bottled minced garlic which adds tons of flavor to your meat. I used diced yellow onions because I had no green onions which I admit would have added more flavor but still this tasted amazing. I will be adding this recipe to my favorites file. Don''t be afraid to substitute what you have on hand because it will still turn out very good. This dish reheats well in the microwave and amazingly tastes even better the next day! I have made this dish for years using lean ground beef and it's good that way too!

this is a great recipe. I took others' suggestions and marinated the beef in wine and used yellow onions instead of green onions. I cooked the beef until brown, added the onions to saute and then added all other ingredients except noodles, and simmered for 1.5 hours. no need to take this or that out of pan. I did use 2/2 tbsp. of cornstarch/flour and combined this with a bit of broth to shake and mix before stirring into meat mixture. worked very well. will definitely make again!! wonderful meal!!
Great recipe. It’s a keeper!

I thought this was excellent and my whole family loved it. My husband joked that he wanted it again tomorrow night. Followed the recipe exactly, as I always do before deciding to change anything. With this one, there’s nothing I’d do differently.
This turned out great! Delicious. I used a pint of fresh sliced baby bella’s instead of the canned mushrooms, but otherwise made as directed. Will be making again!

This is a good springboard for inspiration; I made this recipe twice. I made it the first time following the recipe. Beef chuck is a tough stew meat, you can't really get away with just cooking it one hour. I even tried to cook the meat low and slow longer for almost 2 hours to compensate. The first time I made it, flavor was just OK, and the meat was tough, very dissatisfied.

I decided to use the recipe again as a base but heavily modified this recipe, using a slow cooker and changing ingredients/amounts around, and it turned out amazing the second time (total cook time was between 5-6 hours on high). Beef was fall apart tender. 

If you want to follow this recipe, you are probably better off using sirloin or a more tender meat, otherwise you're likely going to end up with tough beef no matter what you do.

OMG! This was so good. I followed some other reviewers suggestions and marinated the beef in red wine for a few hours, I also sauted 8 oz of fresh mushrooms and used half a cup of frozen dice onions in place of the green onions. very much worth the effort.
This was a family hit! Made it as written except I used sirloin instead of a chuck roast.
Excellent

Love the flavor from the combo of ingredients in the sauce! I also love mushrooms, so 1 can wasn't enough - I cook 2 pounds of fresh mushrooms separately (to let them release their water content) and it's perfect!
Amazing!! I did use fresh mushrooms, garlic and added worcestershire, I also put the wine in and let it cook down with the meat, it was fantastic!

I have been making this for years. It's a great recipe guideline and is incredibly tasty. I have never used canned mushrooms. Always fresh. I also simmer everything together for an hour and add only the sour cream about 15 minutes before serving. I kinda eyeball the amount of broth, wine and mustard. And I only use a nice cabernet sauvignon.....mostly so I can enjoy a couple of glasses myself! Its definitely a favourite in my house. And so rich that it's a treat only a few times a year.
I love this recipe! I use fresh mushrooms and there is never enough left overs!
Fantastic! We prepared everything and added to crock pot for half a day. Very good meal, love the addition of Dijon. Will be making this again!

Turned out very well! For the most part I followed the directions. I did add a bit of Worcester, and a bit more sour cream than the recipe called for. It’s easy to follow, and for the first time making stroganoff, I was very pleased with my end result!

I didn't care for the recipe but it's not the recipes fault. bi didn't have white wine and use white wine vinegar instead. bit changed the taste a lot. I added fresh garlic also which was a plus. I don't think I'll make it again.

I read many recipes for Beef Stroganoff before I decided on this one. I cooked pretty much as presented with some slight modifications most of which were so I could cook in pressure cooker. I removed meat from skillet after browning and sauteed both the onions and mushrooms together, added back the meat then stirred in flour to coat the meat. This helped to prevent lumps. I used 1/3 cup flour in order to have more gravy. Once thoroughly coated and browned, I added 14 oz can of beef broth stirring constantly and added additional water as it thickened to thin appropriately. I then added the mustard and white wine and brought back to slow boil. Transferred to pressure cooker and cooked for 10 minutes under pressure. Removed from heat and allowed pressure to release naturally. Removed lid and continued simmering until thickened then added sour cream. Served over egg noodles. With the pressure cooker, my cooking time was dramatically cut but meat was VERY tender and flavorful. My husband said it was a keeper!
I've made this for years my family loves it followed recipe as is and it's GREAT!!!

Added lots of garlic, a little Worcestershire, subbed 2T cornstarch + 2T flour (instead of all flour)

served over bow-tie pasta

2 lbs of beef

A really great recipe. I’m so glad I started with a chuck roast and cut it into pieces myself instead of using a precut stew meat. The meat was so much more tender that way. Like another reviewer I used a diced yellow onion in the actual recipe and then the green onions for garnish. Delish!!!
Easy recipe. I did not have sour cream so I used plain 2% greek yogurt. Used fresh sliced mushrooms in place of canned. Delicious!
tasty
This is a great recipe! Very easy. I didn't have white wine on hand, so I used white wine vinegar but reduced the amount to 1/4 cup. Everyone loved it!
Great recipe. I use fresh sautéed mushrooms instead of canned.
Like BeeslyS, I marinated the beef in red wine first. I also used fresh mushrooms. My husband and I loved it!

I made this Beef Stroganoff last weekend and I followed the comments that said to add 1/3 cup of cream cheese. Nope never again! I usually love anything with cream cheese but it just didn’t taste good. Before I added the cream cheese and sour cream I thought it was yummy and the sour cream just added to the flavor. That cream cheese gave it a funky flavor. Will use the original recipe with a couple tweaks of my own. This original recipe is fantastic!
this was a great recipe!!! will make it again for sure!!! always love Chef John's recipies!!!
this was a great recipe!!! will make it again for sure!!! always love Chef John's recipies!!!
Meat was nice & tender. Flavor was great. I did add worcestershire sauce. Will def make this again.
Turned out great. Used fresh mushrooms instead of canned. Also made room in the pan to mix flour and juices before putting meat back into pan.
Great flavor, thanks for sharing
Did its and enjoyed it, so creamy

I made this tonight and it was incredible! I did not have all the ingredients so I used lean stew meat cut into small pieces, a package of dry au jus and a beef cube in water cooked down and canned mushrooms. In this new world of ours, improvisation is a necessity!!
Best recipe I’ve found. We loved it.
Took the review of another and marinated the meat in the wine, added the mushrooms, garlic, and Worcestershire during cooking, and cream cheese with sour cream at the end. Everyone loved it!
